newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down before weekend.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down before weekend.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Friday on selling pressure before the Saturday-Sunday weekend, dealers at the Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) said.
The KSE 100-share index ended 13.16 points, or 0.85 percent, down at 1,534.51 amid 159 losers and 57 gainers in a turnover of 13 million shares.
Prices fell as jobbers tried to square their positions in the absence of buyers before the weekend, one dealer said.
Investors had gone to the sidelines before the 1997/98 (July-June) national budget due on June 14, he said. The stocks were likely to open mixed on Monday.

Pakistan State Oil (PSO.KA) fell 6.50 rupees to 311.50, Shell Pakistan (SHEL.KA) 6.0 to 240, Hub Power (HPWR.KA) 0.25 to 37.55, ICI Pakistan (ICI.KA) 0.35 to 24.20 and Dewan Salman Fibre (DEWA.KA) 0.70 to 35.00.
